instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00164 no power on charger
threads.message: Hi Guys, I have a 820-00164 that can runs off the battery, but no charge and not running of AC, no orange light. No shorts on PPBUS, 3.42v and DC-IN lines. No power on PPBUS or 3.42. D7012 is present, tried another U7100, Q7130 and Q7180 with no result. All resistors around U7100 measure OK, battery resistors measure OK. Re-balled SMC also didn't fix it. It can still be powered on from battery, not from charger after all above. On DC-IN line I have 312mah. Have also tried another IO board + cable. Board looks super clean no corrosion. Inspected battery connecter and IO connector all look mighty fine. Anything I forgot to check? Also tried different chargers.

threads.title: 820-00164 no power on charger
threads.message:
Did you try fake charger, or lab PSU?

Be sure J7000 is not broken.
Post R7012 value; measured onboard, ohm scale.

threads.title: 820-00164 no power on charger
threads.message: We use original Apple chargers that work with other macs (we only use for testing). Will check and post back tomorrow with values.

threads.title: 820-00164 no power on charger
threads.message: Spot on. R7012 was off, replaced it and working board:).
